channel.title: [PI] Pie in Varrock and Walking glitch?
channel.description:
[img]http://i1126.photobucket.com/albums/l609/xThaSceneKid/nomnompie.jpg[/img]
ok so 2 things, first...that pie...wat we have here, is a pie...in place...of the varrock statue...how teh hell can i remove that? -.-'' and second..when i wield a godsword of a sara sword, my character doesnt walk...more of does like a slide and it only happens with godswords and saraswords..i just recently added skillcapes so maybe its in animation.java? idk..but anyway..can anyone help me fix these please? ill rep++ the person who can help get this working.

item.title: [PI] Pie in Varrock and Walking glitch?
item.dc:creator: @l0lc0pt3r l0lc0pt3r
item.description:
@l0lc0pt3r wrote:

sorry. rly new to this still :3 ive got most down, but this is new. anyhow…still not sure how to fix this :s what wuld be the easiest or most efficient way to narrow down what the error is?

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Pie in Varrock and Walking glitch?
item.dc:creator: @Coelho Coelho
item.description:
@Coelho wrote:

[quote=“l0lc0pt3r, post:3, topic:401148”][quote author=Coelho link=topic=498210.msg3643193#msg3643193 date=1309176499]
Pie is an overwritten model and godswords is an animation conflict or a server-side issue.
[/quote]
do u happen to know the model # for the varrock statue? and how culd i find the animation conflict\server sided issue, cuz i get no compiler errors…soo :s[/quote]

int test1;
int[] test = new int[1];
for(int i = 0; i < 2; i++)
    test1 = test[i];

That may not give an COMPILING error, but it sure as hell will give a error when you run it. Same thing with your animations and models, just in a different way.

Read full topic
